Can I customize the login methods shown: Can I customize the login methods shown to users?
Choose from a wide variety of login meth: Choose from a wide variety of login methods to suit your users' preferences. Support for VeWorld, WalletConnect, social logins (Google, Apple, Twitter, GitHub), passkeys, and more. Give your users the flexibility they need.
Color, fonts, background color, etc. You: Color, fonts, background color, etc. You can create your own login button, and modal or use the provided one. You can decide to show or not the wallet or transaction modal, or show only specific contents (Send, Receive, Assets, Profile, etc.).
Discover all the possible ways to use th: Discover all the possible ways to use the VeChain Kit to build your next dApp.
Forget about the underlying blockchain i: Forget about the underlying blockchain infrastructure. We handle it for you.
Is the kit free to use?: Is the kit free to use?
Lightweight integration to allow social: Lightweight integration to allow social login users to use the platform and manage their energy assets.
Supports only VeWorld, WalletConnect, an: Supports only VeWorld, WalletConnect, and Sync2 wallets, and fully integrates VeChain Kit UI into the app to enhance the user experience Profile and Wallet modals.
The VeChain Kit is a fantastic foundatio: The VeChain Kit is a fantastic foundation for building on VeChain, especially with its clean hooks and UI components.
The kit is designed to be customizable t: The kit is designed to be customizable to your needs. Decide what features you want to use and which ones you don't. Add call-to-action buttons to your app to guide your users to the features they need.
The kit supports Next.js and React.
The kit supports multiple languages out: The kit supports multiple languages out of the box allowing bidirectional sync between the kit and the host app.
The user pays for the transactions. Howe: The user pays for the transactions. However, if you want to sponsor them (always or only in specific scenarios), you can use the fee delegation feature.
To support all login methods, you need t: To support all login methods, you need to use the kit's own hooks (useSendTransaction and useSignMessage). To fully customize the login experience, you need to use your own Privy account. The VeChain shared Privy integration has some limitations: you cannot target only specific social login methods, you cannot fully customize the login UX (users will need to go through a popup window), and users' signatures are always requested when doing transactions.
Use our hooks and components to speed up: Use our hooks and components to speed up your development and interact with the blockchain.
Uses VeChain Kit end-to-end: login, wall: Uses VeChain Kit end-to-end: login, wallet, hooks, and transaction components.
Uses VeChain Kit only for the login flow: Uses VeChain Kit only for the login flow and for the hooks to manage transactions.
Uses VeChain Kit to allow social login u: Uses VeChain Kit to allow social login users to trade on the platform.
Uses its own Privy setup for social logi: Uses its own Privy setup for social login OAuth2 based methods like Google and Apple
Uses its own Privy setup for social login OAuth2 based methods like Google and Apple.
VeChain Kit UI is fully integrated into: VeChain Kit UI is fully integrated into the app, using a bottom sheet UX on mobile to enhance the user experience.
VeChain Kit is a toolkit for building ap: VeChain Kit is a toolkit for building applications on VeChain, supporting wallet integration, developer hooks, pre-built UI components, and more.
VeChain Kit is an all-in-one SDK for bui: VeChain Kit is an all-in-one SDK for building frontend applications on VeChain blockchain, supporting wallet integration, developer hooks, pre-built UI components, and more.
Yes. VeChain Kit is free to use. If you: Yes. VeChain Kit is free to use. If you want full control over the login experience, you can connect your own Privy account (Privy pricing applies). If you use the shared VeChain + Privy integration, you don't pay anything to get started.
Yes. You can decide to use only veworld,: Yes. You can decide to use only veworld, or only social login methods. To maximize flexibility, you can also use your own Privy account and connect it to VeChain Kit, allowing you to use OAuth2-based login methods like Google, Apple, Twitter, GitHub, etc. and completely customize the login experience.
Yes. You need to use the kit's own hooks: Yes. You need to use the kit's own hooks (useSendTransaction and useSignMessage) to support all login methods. And, to fully customize the login experience, you need to open your own Privy account, since with the shared VeChain + Privy integration you cannot target only specific social login methods and users' signatures are always requested when doing transactions.
